Yes, you. ## Discussion #1 - Did you get bored? - Did you lose sense of time at any point? - Did anything become too difficult at any time? - What did you do at such times? ## What is Flow? ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](tweet.png){fig-align='center' width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Flow.png){fig-align='center' width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: We will understand **Flow** from: 1. The book **Flow and the Psychology of Happiness**, pp; 72-76; by **Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi**. First, let us learn to say his name!! ``{=html} Here is the [book.](Flow_%20The%20Psychology%20of%20Happiness%20-%20Csikszentmihalyi,%20Mihaly.pdf) 1. This video: {{< youtube 8h6IMYRoCZw >}}
2. This TED Talk : [**Flow, the Secret to Happiness**](%22https://www.ted.com/talks/mihaly_csikszentmihalyi_flow_the_secret_to_happiness?utm_campaign=tedspread&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=tedcomshare%22) {{< youtube fXIeFJCqsPs >}}
3. This is Water: David Foster Wallace's famous Talk: {{< youtube eC7xzavzEKY >}}
4. Let us quickly read and discuss this extract from the **Play and Playground Encyclopedia** ## Discussion #2 - Is the idea of Flow elusive? - Do only some people get it, and then only at some times? - Was David Foster Wallace's talk somewhat self-deluding? - Then what is this *Empathy* stuff we talk about when we speak of Design Thinking? ## Pop Quix: Want still more Flow? No, that is not a bad spelling....why not? Go find me in this picture !!
![Pillar Rock](Pillar.JPG) ## {{< iconify fluent-mdl2 decision-solid >}} Conclusions - Flow is a `Zone of Play` between the rising `Floor of Boredom` and the approaching `Ceiling of Anxiety / Challenge` - You need to use the Boredom to push away the Ceiling to stay in Play - To do that, you may need to: - Break Rules: Change how you experience things - Understand your Assumptions: ( More on this later) - Use and Create Surprises: Spot the Problem lurking in your Boredom ## {{< iconify mingcute thought-line >}} Wait, But Why? - Flow is a great state to be in when you are working - It enables you to experience your work, your problem solving, in a way that is unique and hyper productive - And... - If you build / design some thing, wouldn't you want flow for the people who use that thing? - Flow is your gift to your users / customers / clients / audience !! - And so, it is both a beginning, and an end in Design!! ## {{< iconify ooui references-ltr >}} References 1.
